To S
r
Rob. Sidney Fe
b
19 1590

page.lettertext:
fol.88r
1591 stilo
Ro
m
To S
r
Robert Sidney
Belgia: 1591: Feb
r
I am of yo
r
L. opinion for
Medkerk:
for w
ch
I have refrayned
to saie any thing unto him: for I do wholy now attend
e return of
e shippe. By him yo
r
L. will discrye whether plotte is
e better
& whatsoever yo
u
shall resolve, if yo
u
please to lett mee knowe
it I will follow
t
course, that yo
r
self shall approve, w
th
all
if yo
r
L. desire to have
e hono
r
of
e action, if yo
u
be of
opinion, that I am any waie able to steed yo
u
therin, I beseech
yo
r
L. to command mee.
Cap
t
Littelton
hath told me his
errand hether, w
ch
mee think
is a matter very likely to succeed.
All
t
I misdout is
e Jalousie of this people, & chiefly of
Zeland,
w ho I am
swaded for sondry respect
: would not willingly
that her
Ma
ty
should have an oth
r
gouverment so neer unto
them, nor they are not desyrous to advance
e publick
good of
e neybour Province / And wheth
r
in that regard they
may not bee moved to discover the enterprise I leave yo
u
to conjecture. For matter of newes wee are altogether
barren. The [loane] that
S
r
John Norris
hath left heer
among us, hath choaked us for talking of oth
r
occurrences
I have certified into
England
by severall l
re
s, the great
inconvenience of cassing
e Companies, And I have
wished all
e Captaines to attend her Ma
ties
pleasure, before
they do
ceed to putt it in practise, How my advise th
r
in
wilbee construed at home, & what wilbee endevoured by
e Captaines heer I cannot well conjecture, but having had
from her Ma
ty
some
te of a charge in
e conduction of
these affaires, I trust this littell staie, till we heare
againe from thence, wilbee nothing p
r
judiciall to her
principall Intent.
& so for this p
nt
I take my leave
of yo
r
L. Hage. Fe
b
19 1590
